item.title: The making of datasauRus
item.description: Around 8:30pm I saw this tweet and duly retweeted https://t.co/WuyU9D6npK — Richie Cotton (@richierocks) May 1, 2017 It turns out awesome folks, George and Justin, had made a process whereby they can generate different distributions of points that retain the same summary statistics. They used this process for making some friends for Dino the Datasaurus who was created by Alberto Cairo. They made the data for Dino and the rest of the Datasaurus Dozen available for download.
